text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with baked goat cheese caprese
that's right this baked goat cheese dish
is inspired by the usually poorly made
caprese salad which is mozzarella
tomatoes and basil and while I'm not a
big fan of how that salads usually
presented I'm a huge fan of those
flavors and they work so well in this so
we're going to start by prepping some
Tomatoes
unless it's the end of summer and you
can get some awesome vine ripened
tomatoes your best bet is cherry
tomatoes for flavour and sweetness so
these have been rinsed and I'm going to
go ahead and cut them in half but it a
little bit of an angle all right I'm not
going lengthwise I'm not going across
I'm going just like that 45 degree angle
and you might ask why and I don't really
have a good reason but that's okay
that's one of the best things about
cooking you don't have to have a reason
to do things it's really one of the
funnest parts so I'm gonna go ahead and
cut mine across like that and then after
that we're going to go ahead and slice
up some basil so I have a bunch of basil
leaves I picked off a plant in the
backyard which is why they're all kind
of weirdly shaped and have spots on them
but that's okay with a lack and
aesthetic beauty they more than make up
for in freeness and proximity so I'm
going to put those leaves together I'm
going to roll them up into a nice little
tight basil spleef yes that is a
legitimate culinary term now we're going
to take a sharp knife and cut it crossed
into ribbons also known as a Shifa nod
if you like to use the French lingo all
right so once that's done we're going to
go ahead and prep our ramekins I have to
heat proof ramekins I think there's
really five and a half or six ounce size
which is just about perfect we're going
to go ahead and drizzle in just a little
bit of olive oil and then we'll take a
pinch of basil and put it at the bottom
of each one and that is ready for our
goat cheese and there it is a log of
goat cheese I love goat cheese for many
reasons not the least of which is that
it's sold in something called a log so
that's a 4 ounce log I'm going to cut it
in half to get to 2 ounce portions and
this is just plain fresh goat cheese
this is not aged at all alright so I'm
just gonna cut that in half that's going
to make a 2 ounce piece I'm going to
place that into the ramekin on top of
the basil and oil and then we're gonna
surround it with our sliced cherry
tomatoes and not only are those going to
add color and of course a great flavor
they're also going to keep that goat
cheese centered and provide invaluable
cushioning in case we bang the pan going
into the oven that goat cheese will not
be marred ok so we're going to surround
our goat cheese and then we're going to
see
just a little bit you don't want to do
too much to these alright they're so
naturally awesome as is so I'm just
going to put a little bit of cracked
black pepper a little shake of cayenne
and then to finish off we're going to go
ahead and top with the rest of the basil
and then we'll place those on our baking
sheet and before they go in the oven we
will drizzle over just a little more
olive oil and then we're going to pop
those in a very well preheated 400
degree oven for 15 minutes or until it
looks like this it will be beautiful it
will be bubbling and it will be
beckoning if it's not all three of those
things throw in the garbage and start
over
okay but don't worry that's not going to
happen it's going to be gorgeous and
unlike almost everything else we make
you don't have to let this cool throw it
on a plate I put down a little napkin so
it doesn't slide put some toast or some
crackers or some crostini next to it and
you have one of the most amazing and
easiest cheese based appetizers ever
that ovens going to tighten up and dry
out that cheese just a hair yet is still
going to have that incredibly creamy
luxurious texture that people love about
goat cheese so like I said earlier I'm
not a huge fan of the salad it's always
made with unripe Tomatoes so I'm always
disappointed but regardless basil and
tomato have a proven track record of
being incredibly delicious with creamy
cheese's and this is no exception it's
just incredible and that right there my
friends was the perfect bite all right
baked goat cheese caprese super easy
super fast and people will love it
so I really hope you give this a try
head over to food wishes comm for all
the ingredient amounts and more info as
usual and as always enjoy
you
